# EDA Midterm

## Background: 

- Read the document "midterm_data_doc.pdf" to learn about the data.
- The data is in the same repository as this file. It is called "midterm_data.csv"

## Exam: Explore the data. 

- Be clear. 
- At a minimum aim for two well developed, different data visualizations (use two different graphical presentations of the data).
- Summarize your choices at each major step. 
- Interpret your findings.

## Hard facts:

- You have two hours
- You cannot work with other students
- You *must* push your work in an .rmd file to github in *your* midterm repo
- You *must* also knit to MD flavored github doc and push this to github
- Yes you can use this file to write your exam in.

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```
